citances.sentence: Examples are provided in Finn (at para 583) of: a company director separately undertaking to two different companies of which he is a director to use his best endeavours to procure the one profit-making opportunity for each of them exclusively (see Grand Enterprises Pty Ltd v Aurium Resources Ltd (2009) 256 ALR 1 ; [2009] FCA 513 at [29] ) and a solicitor advising both the seller and purchaser of shares, discovering that the purchaser is unlikely to be able to pay the seller the purchase price.
